issue.title: Prune stack traces produced by failing tests

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Resolves #3247

Co-authored-by: Christian Stein <sormuras@gmail.com>

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)

issue.title: Revise stack trace pruning

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Context

Stack trace pruning was introduced in #3247.
We want this feature to be disabled for tests inside this repository (otherwise all stack traces would be almost empty), and it is when the tests are launched via gradle (due to [this setting](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/69e74953eacb174842a65a2d7bf67c4d633de6e9/gradle/plugins/common/src/main/kotlin/junitbuild.testing-conventions.gradle.kts#L44)). But when launched in a different way, this setting have no impact and the feature is therefore enabled when it shouldnâ€™t.

## Solution

A potential solution could be to not prune stack traces of tests specifically located inside the `org.junit` package, even when the feature is enabled.

## Related

- https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/pull/3277#discussion_r1181233970

## Deliverables

- [x] Collect `MethodSource` and `ClassSource` instances from the current test descriptor and its parents, find the bottom-most stackframe with one of these classes, and include all stackframe upward from there
- [x] Don't prune everything from `java.*` and `jdk.*`, just the reflection packages from both but only below the test method
- [x] Remove package pattern configuration parameter introduced in M1
